New Records: DeMar DeRozan scored 30 points, including 9 points in the second overtime to help the Kings win
Key Match Events: The game was tied at 102 at the end of regulation and at 112 after the first overtime
Jaime Jaquez Jr. had a triple-double with 16 points, 12 rebounds and 10 assists for Miami
Tyler Herro scored 26 but was called for a costly 8-second violation toward the end of the fourth quarter
DeRozan took over after that with a 3-pointer and a trio of step-back jumpers that stunned Miami
Jaquez missed a pair of free throws with 3 seconds left in the first overtime
Pre-Game Insights: Experts or the article does not mention any specific predictions or expectations about the match outcome
Coach Doug Christie emphasized the importance of his team's effort under his leadership
Post-Match Reflections: The Kings are playing with a lot more heart and effort under Christie than they did the final two weeks under former coach Mike Brown
The Heat got sloppy in overtime
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings won their second straight without injured point guard De'Aaron Fox
The Heat are 4-7 without Jimmy Butler this season
The game was played in Sacramento, California
